segments.en: 159. Focus, the Exterior, and the End of Relishing

segments.pli: “Rūpe, bhikkhave, yoniso manasi karotha, rūpāniccatañca yathābhūtaṃ samanupassatha.
segments.en: “Mendicants, properly attend to sights. Truly see the impermanence of sights.

segments.pli: Rūpe, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yoniso manasikaronto, rūpāniccatañca yathābhūtaṃ samanupassanto rūpesupi nibbindati.
segments.en: When a mendicant does this, they grow disillusioned with sights.
When relishing ends, greed ends. When greed ends, relishing ends.
When relishing and greed end, the mind is said to be well freed.

segments.pli: dhamme, bhikkhave, yoniso manasi karotha, dhammāniccatañca yathābhūtaṃ samanupassatha.
segments.en: thoughts. Truly see the impermanence of thoughts.

segments.pli: Dhamme, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yoniso manasikaronto, dhammāniccatañca yathābhūtaṃ samanupassanto dhammesupi nibbindati.
segments.en: When a mendicant does this, they grow disillusioned with thoughts.
When relishing and greed end, the mind is said to be well freed.”
